info.title: ServiceNow Asset Deletion API
info.description: ServiceNow REST API for deleting assets

bearerAuth.description: OAuth 2.0 Bearer Token authentication. Obtain token via ServiceNow OAuth endpoint using Resource Owner Password Credentials grant.

delete.description:
Delete an asset from ServiceNow

⚠️ CRITICAL: This operation requires the sys_id (NOT the asset tag) ⚠️

This is a DESTRUCTIVE operation that permanently removes the asset record.

- sys_id is a unique identifier like "32ac0eaec326361067d91a2ed40131a7"
- Asset tag is like "P1000234"

REQUIRED EXECUTION PATTERN:

When user asks to delete asset by tag (e.g., "Delete asset P1000234"):

CALL 1 - Query to Get sys_id:
1. Call queryAssets(sysparm_query="asset_tag=P1000234", sysparm_fields="sys_id,asset_tag,display_name,install_status")
2. Extract sys_id from result
3. Verify exactly 1 result returned
4. OPTIONAL: Display asset details to user for confirmation before deletion

CALL 2 - Delete with Retrieved sys_id:
1. Call deleteAsset(sys_id="32ac0eaec326361067d91a2ed40131a7")
2. This will permanently delete the asset

Best Practices:
- Always confirm with user before deleting
- Show asset details (tag, name, assigned user) before deletion
- Consider retiring assets (install_status=7) instead of deleting
- Deletion is permanent and cannot be undone
- Check if asset has related records (CIs, contracts) that may be affected

Permissions:
- User must have delete rights on alm_asset table
- Some organizations restrict asset deletion for compliance/audit reasons

parameters.name: sys_id
parameters.description: The unique sys_id of the asset to delete (obtain via queryAssets first)

204.description: Asset deleted successfully - No content returned

404.description: Asset not found - Invalid sys_id or already deleted

401.description: Unauthorized - Invalid or missing authentication token

403.description: Forbidden - User lacks delete permissions on alm_asset table
